data.content:
Azir (SKT T1 Azir)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: April 30, 2015

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir can dominate the battlefield and control the flow of the game. As one of the most iconic champions in the game, Azir has received several skins, each offering a unique visual and thematic experience. One of these skins is the SKT T1 Azir skin, which pays homage to the legendary Korean esports team, SK Telecom T1.

The SKT T1 Azir skin was released on April 30, 2015, and is priced at 1350 RP. This skin transforms Azir into a member of the SK Telecom T1 team, featuring their iconic black and red color scheme. The skin also includes new visual effects, animations, and sound effects, giving Azir a fresh and exciting look on the battlefield.

The SKT T1 Azir skin showcases Azir as a formidable leader, donning the team's uniform and carrying a staff adorned with the SK Telecom T1 logo. His sand soldiers are transformed into loyal teammates, wearing the team's colors and displaying the SK Telecom T1 emblem on their shields. The skin also introduces new particle effects, such as golden sand trails and SK Telecom T1-themed abilities, adding a touch of elegance and prestige to Azir's already impressive arsenal.

Azir's story within the League of Legends universe is one of ambition, power, and betrayal. Born as a mortal emperor of Shurima, Azir sought immortality and the restoration of his fallen empire. Through ancient rituals and the power of the sun disc, Azir transformed himself into an Ascended being, becoming the Emperor of the Sands. However, his thirst for power led him down a dark path, and he was ultimately betrayed by his closest ally, Xerath.

In the game, Azir is a mage who excels at controlling the battlefield and dealing sustained damage. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, allows him to summon sand soldiers that can attack enemies from a distance. These soldiers can be commanded to dash towards enemies, dealing damage and applying crowd control effects. Azir's ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, creates a massive wall of sand that knocks back enemies and provides a strong zoning tool.

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to dominate team fights and control objectives. With his sand soldiers, he can poke enemies from a safe distance and engage in fights with his ultimate ability. His passive also allows him to push lanes and siege turrets effectively, making him a strong pick in competitive play. However, Azir's reliance on positioning and coordination with his sand soldiers makes him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high mobility. Additionally, his early game can be challenging, as he requires time to scale and reach his full potential.

Throughout his journey in the League of Legends game, Azir has become a fan-favorite champion, known for his unique playstyle and powerful abilities. The SKT T1 Azir skin adds another layer of excitement for both Azir enthusiasts and fans of the SK Telecom T1 team. With its stunning visuals and thematic elements, this skin allows players to embody the spirit of the legendary team while commanding the sands as Azir.

If you want to explore more about Azir and his various appearances in the game, including the SKT T1 Azir skin, you can find detailed information and videos on this page. Immerse yourself in the world of Azir and experience the power of the Emperor of the Sands in all his glory.

Azir (Default)

Cost: N/A | Release Date: N/A

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. As the ruler of Shurima, Azir commands an army of sand soldiers and wields the power of the sun disc. His default skin represents his original appearance in the game and showcases his regal and majestic presence on the battlefield.

The default skin for Azir features him in his traditional Shuriman attire. He wears a golden headdress adorned with feathers, symbolizing his status as the emperor. His armor is intricately designed with golden accents and blue gemstones, reflecting his connection to the sun and the desert. Azir carries a staff with a sun disc at the top, which he uses to summon and control his sand soldiers.

The default skin perfectly captures Azir's role as a powerful mage and leader. The attention to detail in his outfit and accessories highlights his regal nature and his connection to the ancient civilization of Shurima. The golden color scheme adds a touch of grandeur to his appearance, making him stand out on the battlefield.

Now, let's delve into the story of Azir and explore his strengths, weaknesses, and his place in the game. Azir's lore revolves around the fallen empire of Shurima. Once a glorious civilization, Shurima was destroyed and buried in the sands of the desert. Azir, a mortal emperor, was betrayed and killed by his closest ally, Xerath, who sought to claim the power of the sun disc for himself.

However, Azir's spirit endured, and with the help of ancient magic, he returned as an Ascended being. He seeks to rebuild Shurima and restore its former glory. Azir's abilities in the game reflect his connection to the sun and the sands. He can summon sand soldiers to attack his enemies, create impassable walls of sand, and even resurrect fallen turrets on the battlefield.

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to control the battlefield and deal massive damage from a safe distance. His sand soldiers allow him to poke and harass enemies, while his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, can completely disrupt team fights by separating enemies and creating zones of control. Azir's versatility makes him a valuable asset in both offensive and defensive situations.

However, Azir also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is a relatively squishy champion and lacks mobility, making him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high burst damage. Azir's abilities require precise positioning and timing to maximize their effectiveness, making him a challenging champion to master.

In the game, Azir is primarily played in the mid lane as a mage. His ability to push lanes and control objectives makes him a strong pick in competitive play. Azir's presence in team fights can turn the tide in favor of his team, and his ability to siege and defend turrets makes him a valuable asset in both offense and defense.

On this page, you can find information and videos about all the appearances of Azir, including his various skins. Each skin offers a unique visual and thematic twist to the champion, allowing players to customize their experience and showcase their personal style. Whether it's the classic default skin or one of the many alternative options, Azir's appearance is sure to impress both allies and enemies on the battlefield.

Azir (Worlds 2022 Azir)

RP: TBA | Release Date: TBA

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a formidable leader in the world of League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir dominates the battlefield with his strategic prowess. As one of the most iconic champions in the game, Azir has received numerous skins over the years, each offering a unique visual and thematic experience. One of the most highly anticipated skins for Azir is the Worlds 2022 Azir skin, which is set to be released in the near future.

The Worlds 2022 Azir skin is a special edition skin that celebrates the annual League of Legends World Championship. This prestigious event brings together the best teams from around the world to compete for the title of world champion. The skin is designed to reflect the grandeur and excitement of this global tournament, with Azir taking on a new look that embodies the spirit of the Worlds.

In the Worlds 2022 Azir skin, Azir is transformed into a majestic and regal figure. His armor is adorned with intricate gold and blue designs, symbolizing his status as a powerful ruler. The feathers on his headdress and cape flow gracefully, adding a touch of elegance to his appearance. The sand soldiers he summons also receive a makeover, donning the colors and emblems of the competing teams in the World Championship. This attention to detail showcases the dedication and craftsmanship that goes into creating these special edition skins.

Not only does the Worlds 2022 Azir skin offer a visually stunning experience, but it also comes with unique particle effects and sound effects. When Azir summons his sand soldiers, they emerge from the ground with a burst of energy, leaving a trail of shimmering sand in their wake. The sound of their footsteps echoes with a sense of power and authority, further enhancing the immersive gameplay experience. Additionally, Azir's abilities are given a thematic twist, with his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, creating a grand arena that resembles the stage of the World Championship finals.

Azir's story within the League of Legends universe is one of ambition, betrayal, and redemption. Once a mortal emperor of Shurima, Azir sought immortality and power through ancient magic. However, his plans were thwarted by his closest ally, Xerath, who betrayed him and unleashed a cataclysmic event that destroyed the empire of Shurima. Azir was presumed dead, but centuries later, he was resurrected as an Ascended being, a being of immense power and control over the sands.

Now, Azir seeks to rebuild the empire of Shurima and restore it to its former glory. With his newfound abilities and the loyalty of his sand soldiers, he fights to reclaim his throne and bring order to the chaotic world. Azir's strengths lie in his ability to control the battlefield and dictate the flow of combat. His sand soldiers can be positioned strategically to zone enemies and deal damage from a safe distance. Additionally, his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, can separate and displace enemies, creating opportunities for his team to engage or disengage.

However, Azir also has his weaknesses. He is a relatively squishy champion, meaning he can be easily burst down if caught out of position. His abilities require precise positioning and timing to maximize their effectiveness, making him a challenging champion to master. Azir's reliance on his sand soldiers also makes him vulnerable to champions who can quickly close the gap and disrupt his formations.

In the world of League of Legends, Azir holds a significant place as a high skill-cap champion with immense potential. His unique playstyle and strategic depth make him a favorite among experienced players who enjoy the challenge of mastering complex mechanics. With the release of the Worlds 2022 Azir skin, players will have the opportunity to showcase their dedication to the game and their love for the competitive scene.

To learn more about Azir and his various appearances, including the upcoming Worlds 2022 Azir skin, be sure to visit our page dedicated to the Emperor of the Sands. There, you will find detailed information, videos, and more, allowing you to immerse yourself in the world of Azir and experience the grandeur of the League of Legends World Championship.

Azir: The Emperor of the Sands

Release Date: September 16, 2014

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir dominates the battlefield with his control and zoning capabilities. In this article, we will delve into Azir's story, his strengths and weaknesses, his background in the game, and his place in the League of Legends universe.

The Story of Azir

Azir's tale begins in the ancient city of Shurima, a once-great civilization that fell into ruin and was buried beneath the sands. Azir, a young and ambitious emperor, sought to restore Shurima to its former glory. He was a visionary leader who believed in the power of his people and the potential of his empire.

Driven by his desire to resurrect Shurima, Azir discovered an ancient artifact known as the Sun Disc. With the help of Xerath, his most trusted advisor, Azir unlocked the Sun Disc's power, transforming himself into an Ascended being and granting him control over the sands.

However, Xerath's lust for power corrupted him, leading to a catastrophic betrayal. Xerath turned against Azir, causing a cataclysmic event that destroyed Shurima and left Azir entombed in the ruins for centuries.

Centuries later, Azir was awakened by the young mage Sivir, who sought the Sun Disc for her own purposes. Azir, now a being of pure energy and sand, returned to the world with a burning desire to rebuild Shurima and seek vengeance against Xerath.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to control the battlefield and deal massive damage from a safe distance. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, allows him to summon sand soldiers that can attack enemies from a distance. These soldiers can be used to poke and harass opponents, as well as zone them away from objectives or important areas.

His Q ability, Conquering Sands, sends forth a wave of sand that damages and slows enemies. This ability can be used to poke enemies, clear minion waves, or reposition his sand soldiers for maximum effectiveness.

Azir's W ability, Arise!, is his bread and butter. It allows him to summon a sand soldier at a target location, which then attacks nearby enemies. This ability is crucial for Azir's damage output and zoning potential. Skilled Azir players can position their soldiers strategically to control the flow of team fights and objectives.

His E ability, Shifting Sands, is a mobility tool that allows Azir to dash to one of his sand soldiers, dealing damage to enemies in his path. This ability provides Azir with an escape mechanism and can also be used aggressively to engage or reposition during fights.

Azir's ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, is a game-changer. He summons a massive wall of soldiers that knocks back enemies and creates impassable terrain. This ability can be used to separate enemies, disengage from fights, or secure objectives. It requires precise timing and positioning to maximize its effectiveness.

Despite his strengths, Azir also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is a highly mechanical champion, requiring precise positioning and timing to fully utilize his kit. Azir's abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during their downtime. Additionally, he is quite squishy and lacks mobility without his sand soldiers, making him susceptible to assassins and champions with high burst damage.

Azir's Background in the Game

Azir was released on September 16, 2014, as a mid-lane mage. He quickly became a favorite among players who enjoyed his unique playstyle and high skill ceiling. Azir's ability to dominate team fights and control objectives made him a popular pick in competitive play as well.

Over the years, Azir has received several balance changes and adjustments to fine-tune his gameplay. Riot Games, the developer of League of Legends, has worked to ensure that Azir remains a viable and balanced champion in the game's ever-evolving meta.

Azir's lore and story have also been expanded upon through various in-game events and updates. Players can uncover more about his past and his role in the League of Legends universe through the game's lore and champion interactions.

Azir's Place in the Game

Azir holds a unique place in the League of Legends universe. As the Emperor of the Sands, he represents the grandeur and power of the fallen empire of Shurima. His abilities and playstyle make him a formidable force on the battlefield, capable of turning the tide of team fights and controlling objectives.

With his sand soldiers, Azir excels at sieging and defending towers, making him a valuable asset in both offensive and defensive strategies. His zoning capabilities and long-range damage allow him to control the flow of team fights, making it difficult for enemies to engage or disengage effectively.

Azir's versatility also extends to his build paths and playstyles. Players can choose to build him as a burst mage, focusing on ability power and magic penetration, or as a sustained damage dealer, opting for attack speed and on-hit effects. This flexibility allows players to adapt their playstyle to the needs of their team and the game's circumstances.

Overall, Azir is a complex and rewarding champion to master. His unique abilities and playstyle make him a favorite among players who enjoy strategic and calculated gameplay. Whether you seek to dominate the mid-lane or command the battlefield with your sand soldiers, Azir offers a thrilling and challenging experience in the world of League of Legends.

For more information about Azir and to explore his various skins, including videos showcasing their visual and sound effects, visit our dedicated page on the League of Legends website.

Azir (Galactic Azir)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: August 27, 2015

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir dominates the battlefield with his strategic prowess. As a champion with a rich lore and a strong presence in the game, Azir has received several skins, each offering a unique visual and thematic experience. One of these skins is Galactic Azir, which takes Azir's celestial powers to a whole new level.

Galactic Azir is a skin that transforms Azir into a cosmic being, adorned with celestial armor and wielding a staff that channels the power of the stars. Released on August 27, 2015, this skin is priced at 1350 RP, offering players a visually stunning and thematically fitting alternative to Azir's default appearance.

The Galactic Azir skin features a complete visual overhaul for Azir, giving him a futuristic and otherworldly look. His armor is adorned with intricate cosmic patterns, and his staff is transformed into a celestial weapon that glows with cosmic energy. Azir himself radiates a celestial aura, emphasizing his connection to the stars and the vastness of the universe. The sand soldiers summoned by Azir also receive a cosmic makeover, appearing as ethereal beings made of stardust and cosmic energy.

The attention to detail in the Galactic Azir skin is truly remarkable. From the intricate patterns on his armor to the mesmerizing cosmic effects, every aspect of the skin is designed to immerse players in the cosmic theme. The animations for Azir's abilities are also modified, with each ability showcasing the power of the stars. Whether it's summoning sand soldiers or unleashing his ultimate ability, Azir's cosmic powers are on full display with this skin.

Now, let's delve into the story of Azir and how he fits into the world of League of Legends. Azir was once a mortal emperor of Shurima, an ancient and powerful civilization. However, his thirst for power led him down a dark path, and he was betrayed and killed by his closest ally, Xerath. Centuries later, Azir was resurrected as an Ascended being, a being of immense power and divine purpose. With his newfound powers over sand and the ability to summon an army of sand soldiers, Azir seeks to reclaim his empire and restore Shurima to its former glory.

In the game, Azir is classified as a mage and a marksman, combining long-range attacks with the ability to control the battlefield. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, allows him to summon sand soldiers that can attack enemies from a distance. His Q ability, Conquering Sands, sends forth a wave of sand, damaging and slowing enemies. His W ability, Arise! summons sand soldiers to attack nearby enemies. His E ability, Shifting Sands, allows him to dash to a target location, damaging and knocking up enemies in his path. Finally, his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, creates a massive wall of sand soldiers that knocks back enemies and blocks their movement.

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to control the battlefield and deal consistent damage from a safe distance. With his sand soldiers, he can harass enemies and zone them away from objectives. His ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, can be a game-changer, separating enemies and disrupting their positioning. However, Azir's reliance on his sand soldiers makes him vulnerable if they are destroyed or if he is caught off-guard. He requires careful positioning and coordination with his team to maximize his effectiveness.

In the world of League of Legends, Azir holds a significant place as a powerful mage and a key figure in the lore. His story intertwines with other champions, such as Xerath and Nasus, adding depth and complexity to the game's narrative. As players explore the vast universe of League of Legends, they can uncover the secrets of Shurima and witness the epic clash between Azir and his enemies.

To learn more about Azir and his various appearances, including the Galactic Azir skin, you can visit this page. Here, you will find detailed information, videos, and images showcasing Azir's journey and the visual evolution of his character. Whether you're a fan of Azir or simply curious about the world of League of Legends, this page offers a comprehensive resource to satisfy your curiosity.

Azir (Warring Kingdoms Azir)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: January 28, 2016

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir dominates the battlefield with his strategic prowess and immense power. As one of the most iconic champions in the game, Azir has received numerous skins, each offering a unique visual and thematic experience. One such skin is the Warring Kingdoms Azir, which takes Azir's regal persona to new heights.

The Warring Kingdoms Azir skin is a part of the Warring Kingdoms skin line, which features champions in ancient Chinese-inspired attire. Released on January 28, 2016, this skin offers players a chance to embody Azir as a majestic warrior from a bygone era. With its intricate design and attention to detail, the Warring Kingdoms Azir skin truly stands out among Azir's other appearances.

The skin transforms Azir into a formidable warrior, adorned in traditional Chinese armor and wielding a magnificent staff. His armor is intricately decorated with golden accents and vibrant red hues, symbolizing power and nobility. The staff he carries is adorned with a majestic phoenix, representing rebirth and strength. The sand soldiers summoned by Azir also receive a makeover, donning the same regal armor as their emperor. The visual effects of Azir's abilities are also modified to match the theme, with sand turning into swirling red and gold patterns, adding an extra layer of grandeur to his already impressive arsenal.

The Warring Kingdoms Azir skin not only offers a visually stunning experience but also adds a new dimension to Azir's lore and story. In the League of Legends universe, Azir is the rightful ruler of Shurima, an ancient and powerful empire. However, he was betrayed and killed by his closest ally, Xerath, leading to the fall of Shurima. With the Warring Kingdoms Azir skin, players can imagine a different timeline where Azir's empire thrives, and he becomes a revered warrior-king. This alternate narrative adds depth to Azir's character and allows players to explore different facets of his story.

In terms of gameplay, Azir is a complex champion who excels in controlling the battlefield and dealing sustained damage. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, allows him to summon sand soldiers that can attack enemies from a distance. This ability, combined with his other skills, makes Azir a formidable force in team fights and sieges. However, Azir's complexity also makes him challenging to master, requiring precise positioning and timing to maximize his potential.

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to zone enemies and control objectives. With his sand soldiers, he can create impassable barriers and force enemies to reposition, giving his team a significant advantage. Additionally, Azir's ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, can separate enemy teams and disrupt their formations, making it easier for his allies to engage or disengage from fights. These strengths make Azir a valuable asset in coordinated team play and competitive matches.

However, Azir also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. His reliance on positioning and precise control means that he is vulnerable to crowd control and assassins who can quickly close the gap. Azir's damage output also requires time to ramp up, making him less effective in short skirmishes or burst damage scenarios. Additionally, his sand soldiers can be destroyed by enemy champions, limiting his ability to control the battlefield if not properly protected.

In the ever-evolving world of League of Legends, Azir continues to be a popular and influential champion. His unique playstyle and rich lore make him a favorite among players who enjoy strategic gameplay and immersive storytelling. With the Warring Kingdoms Azir skin, players can further immerse themselves in Azir's world, experiencing the grandeur of an ancient warrior-king.

To explore all of Azir's appearances, including the Warring Kingdoms Azir skin, you can visit the official League of Legends website or watch videos showcasing his various skins on platforms like YouTube. Whether you choose to command an army of sand soldiers or embrace the regal warrior within, Azir offers a captivating and rewarding experience for players willing to master his unique abilities.

Azir (Elderwood Azir)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: September 24, 2020

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, has long been revered for his regal presence and commanding abilities on the Fields of Justice. With his new skin, Elderwood Azir, he takes on a mystical and ethereal form, embodying the ancient power of the Elderwood.

Elderwood Azir is a visually stunning skin that transforms Azir into a majestic being of nature. His armor is adorned with intricate wooden patterns, and his staff is replaced with a mystical tree branch. The sand soldiers that he summons take on the appearance of ancient forest spirits, and his abilities are imbued with the essence of the Elderwood.

The skin features new visual effects, animations, and sound effects that enhance the overall experience of playing as Azir. The sand soldiers now leave behind a trail of leaves as they move, and their attacks are accompanied by the soothing sounds of nature. Azir's ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, creates a barrier of swirling leaves and branches, adding a touch of mysticism to his already powerful ability.

With Elderwood Azir, players can truly feel the ancient power of the Elderwood coursing through their veins. The skin offers a unique and immersive experience, allowing players to connect with the natural world and harness its power in battle.

Azir: The Emperor of the Sands

Azir is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. He is known for his ability to summon sand soldiers and control the battlefield with his powerful abilities. As the Emperor of the Sands, Azir wields the power of the Shuriman empire and seeks to reclaim his lost kingdom.

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to control the battlefield and deal massive damage from a safe distance. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, allows him to summon sand soldiers that can attack enemies from a distance. These sand soldiers can be used to poke enemies, zone them away from objectives, or engage in team fights with devastating force.

His Q ability, Conquering Sands, sends forth a wave of sand that damages and slows enemies. This ability can be used to poke enemies, clear minion waves, or reposition the sand soldiers for maximum damage. Azir's W ability, Arise!, allows him to summon sand soldiers at a target location, further enhancing his zoning and damage potential.

Azir's E ability, Shifting Sands, allows him to dash to one of his sand soldiers, repositioning himself and dealing damage to enemies in his path. This ability provides Azir with mobility and escape options, making him a difficult target to catch. Finally, his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, summons a massive wall of soldiers that knocks back enemies and creates a barrier that enemies cannot pass through.

Despite his strengths, Azir also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is a relatively squishy champion and can be easily burst down if caught out of position. Additionally, his abilities require precise positioning and timing to maximize their effectiveness. Azir's sand soldiers are also vulnerable to crowd control effects, making it important for players to protect them during team fights.

In the lore of League of Legends, Azir was once a mortal emperor of Shurima who was betrayed and killed by his closest ally, Xerath. However, through the power of ancient magic, Azir was reborn as a Ascended being, a being of immense power and knowledge. He seeks to rebuild the Shuriman empire and restore it to its former glory.

Azir's story is one of redemption and determination. He is a champion who has overcome great adversity and risen to become a powerful force on the Fields of Justice. With his Elderwood Azir skin, players can experience the ancient power of the Elderwood and channel it through Azir's abilities.

On this page, you can find information and videos about all the appearances of Azir, including his base skin and other available skins. Explore the different looks and playstyles of this powerful mage and discover the one that suits your playstyle the best.

Azir (Gravelord Azir)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: August 26, 2015

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir can dominate the battlefield and control the flow of the game. As a champion with a rich lore and a unique playstyle, Azir has captured the hearts of many players. One of his most popular skins is the Gravelord Azir skin, which transforms him into a fearsome undead ruler.

The Story of Gravelord Azir

Gravelord Azir is a skin that takes Azir's theme to a darker and more sinister level. In this skin, Azir becomes a powerful undead ruler, commanding an army of skeletal soldiers. The skin features a complete visual overhaul, with Azir's armor and staff taking on a more macabre appearance. His sand soldiers are replaced with skeletal warriors, and his abilities are accompanied by eerie visual effects.

The inspiration for Gravelord Azir comes from the concept of necromancy and the undead. Azir, who was once a powerful emperor, has now risen from the grave to reclaim his lost kingdom. With his newfound powers over death, he commands an army of undead soldiers to do his bidding. The skin's design reflects this theme, with Azir's armor adorned with bones and his staff emitting an eerie green glow.

The visual effects of Gravelord Azir are truly impressive. When Azir summons his skeletal soldiers, they rise from the ground in a cloud of green mist. As they attack, their strikes leave behind trails of ghostly energy. Azir's abilities also receive a dark makeover, with his Q ability, Conquering Sands, sending forth a wave of skeletal hands, and his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, creating a wall of bones to separate his enemies.

Azir: The Emperor of the Sands

Azir's story in League of Legends is one of power, betrayal, and redemption. Once a mortal emperor of Shurima, Azir sought to unlock the secrets of immortality and reshape the world in his image. However, his plans were thwarted by his closest ally, Xerath, who betrayed him and caused the fall of Shurima. Azir was believed to be dead, but he was reborn as an Ascended being, a powerful being of pure energy.

As an Ascended, Azir returned to Shurima to reclaim his lost kingdom. With his newfound powers over sand and the ability to summon an army of sand soldiers, Azir became a formidable force on the battlefield. His abilities allow him to control the flow of the game, zoning out enemies with his sand soldiers and dealing massive damage with his spells.

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to dominate team fights and control objectives. With his sand soldiers, he can poke enemies from a safe distance and engage in fights with his ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, which can separate the enemy team and create opportunities for his allies. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, also allows him to resurrect turrets, giving his team a strong advantage in pushing and defending objectives.

However, Azir also has his weaknesses. He is a squishy mage with low mobility, making him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high burst damage. Azir's abilities also require precise positioning and timing to maximize their effectiveness, making him a difficult champion to master. Additionally, his sand soldiers can be destroyed by enemy champions, limiting his damage output in team fights.

Despite his weaknesses, Azir remains a popular pick in competitive play and a favorite among players who enjoy strategic and high-skill cap champions. His unique playstyle and lore make him a fascinating character to explore, and his Gravelord Azir skin adds an extra layer of excitement to his gameplay.

Explore Azir's Appearances

If you want to learn more about Azir and his various appearances in League of Legends, you can find information and videos on his champion page. From his classic Emperor of the Sands skin to the dark and menacing Gravelord Azir, each appearance offers a unique visual and gameplay experience. Whether you're a fan of Azir's lore or simply enjoy playing him on the Rift, there's something for everyone to discover.

Azir: The Emperor of the Sands

Release Date: September 16, 2014

Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, is a powerful mage and a versatile champion in the game League of Legends. With his ability to summon and command an army of sand soldiers, Azir dominates the battlefield with his control and zoning capabilities. In this article, we will delve into Azir's story, his strengths and weaknesses, his background in the game, and his place in the League of Legends universe.

The Story of Azir

Azir's tale begins in the ancient city of Shurima, a once-great civilization that fell into ruin and was buried beneath the sands. Azir, a young and ambitious emperor, sought to restore Shurima to its former glory. He was a visionary leader who believed in the power of his people and the potential of his empire.

Driven by his desire to resurrect Shurima, Azir discovered an ancient artifact known as the Sun Disc. With the help of Xerath, his most trusted advisor, Azir unlocked the Sun Disc's power, transforming himself into an Ascended being and granting him control over the sands.

However, Xerath's lust for power corrupted him, leading to a catastrophic betrayal. Xerath turned against Azir, causing a cataclysmic event that destroyed Shurima and left Azir entombed in the ruins for centuries.

Centuries later, Azir was awakened by the young mage Sivir, who sought the Sun Disc for her own purposes. Azir, now a being of pure energy and sand, returned to the world with a burning desire to rebuild Shurima and seek vengeance against Xerath.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Azir's strengths lie in his ability to control the battlefield and deal massive damage from a safe distance. His passive ability, Shurima's Legacy, allows him to summon sand soldiers that can attack enemies from a distance. These soldiers can be used to poke and harass opponents, as well as zone them away from objectives or important areas.

His Q ability, Conquering Sands, sends forth a wave of sand that damages and slows enemies. This ability can be used to poke, wave clear, or set up engages for his team. When combined with his W ability, Arise!, Azir can summon sand soldiers to attack enemies, dealing significant damage and providing him with a strong zoning tool.

Azir's E ability, Shifting Sands, allows him to dash to one of his sand soldiers, repositioning himself and potentially escaping dangerous situations. This ability also provides him with additional mobility and can be used to engage or disengage fights.

Finally, Azir's ultimate ability, Emperor's Divide, is a game-changer. He summons a massive wall of sand soldiers that knocks back enemies and creates a barrier that enemies cannot pass through. This ability can be used to separate enemies, protect allies, or disrupt enemy engages.

However, Azir does have weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is a relatively squishy champion and can be easily burst down if caught out of position. Additionally, his abilities require precise positioning and timing to maximize their effectiveness. Azir also has a steep learning curve, making him a challenging champion to master.

Azir's Background in the Game

Azir was released on September 16, 2014, as a mid-lane mage in League of Legends. He quickly became a popular pick among players due to his unique playstyle and powerful abilities. However, his strength led to him being frequently picked in professional play, resulting in multiple balance changes to bring him in line with other champions.

Over the years, Azir has received several adjustments to his abilities and base stats to ensure a fair and balanced gameplay experience. These changes have aimed to maintain his identity as a control mage while addressing any issues that may arise from his kit.

Despite the adjustments, Azir remains a strong pick in the mid-lane, especially in the hands of skilled players who can utilize his sand soldiers to their full potential. His ability to control team fights and siege objectives makes him a valuable asset to any team composition.

Azir in the League of Legends Universe

Azir's story is deeply intertwined with the lore of the League of Legends universe. As the Emperor of the Sands, he represents the ancient and powerful civilization of Shurima. His return to the world after centuries of slumber has sparked intrigue and conflict among other champions.

Azir's rivalry with Xerath, his former advisor turned betrayer, is a central theme in his lore. Their clash of ideals and thirst for power adds depth to their characters and fuels their ongoing conflict. Azir's quest to rebuild Shurima and seek justice against Xerath is a driving force in his narrative.

As players explore the League of Legends universe, they can uncover more about Azir's story through in-game interactions, champion interactions, and lore updates. His presence in the game adds richness and diversity to the ever-expanding world of League of Legends.
